page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content: {RAILWAYS} Our local railway-line is known as{the "North-Warwickshire- Line".It runs from Birmingham(Moor St) to Stratford upon Avon.It is mainly used for passenger traffic,but new cars are also carried in special transporters.The trains are Diesel-Multiple-Units.The two British Rail Stations in our area are "Shirley"&"Whitlock's End Halt". There are 31 weekday trains from Shirley to Birmingham & 33 weekday trains from Birmingham to Shirley,14 of which go on to Stratford. The line was originally owned by G.W.R.(Great Western Railway).During 1985 several Steam-Weekends took place.It was the first time in 10 years passengers had been pulled by steam on the route.At present the line is under threat of closure by B.R.
